content: Works with voicelive 3 extreme !

Works perfectly with my Behringer X Air XR18 and Google Pixel 2. I wish I knew about this way sooner...It would have made recording live shows a breeze compared to setting up someone's expensive laptop. I really wish that it recorded in mono instead of stereo but realize that might work the Android system harder. It's not a big deal separating the tracks in reaper. Being able to record 8 stereo tracks into an old phone is pretty remarkable. Not enough people in the music scene know about this...

Hello, the app does not work with my emagic emi 2/6 sound card. It's an old one but supported on all Linux systems. An external psu didn't help. I tried to get a refund but it's not working, please get back to me via email.
replyContent: Please contact support@audio-evolution.com since app developers cannot see your email address when posting a review.

content: *edit*(Using the BOSS RC-300). Initially did not work for me. Great support team contacted me right away and got it working. Now works great for recording over USB. Reason for not giving 5 stars is that unfortunately it does not work while recording video with the camera.
replyContent: That's often the case for Roland or Boss devices since they are not fully USB audio class compliant. Please contact support@audio-evolution.com so we can check if something can be done about it.

content: Please, dear developer, you have to make that this app could record when app is background
Did not comply
Freezes on start up every time.
replyContent: Please uninstall and reinstall from the Play store. If that doesn't help, please contact support@audio-evolution.com

content: Works with Creative K3+ and ROG Phone 3.
Great app and it supports my M-track device
Doesn't work with my yamaha mg12XU mixer
replyContent: Please contact support at support@audio-evolution.com

content: Just crashes. Completely unusable.
replyContent: Please contact support at support@audio-evolution.com

content: What an app! I plugged my usb mixer into my phone via an OTG cable and boom! High quality audio recordings of my mixs no probs. Dont need a lappy for anything to do with djing now. Hats off üôÇüí™üëç
Omg is working on USB-C
Using CAT S41 and Focusrite Scarlett Solo, very quick and easy install, first recording flawless.
The app do what it says. Excellent job on the customer service for any technical & app support. Feel grateful for my purchase. :)

Does what it says using my M-Audio FastTrack Ultra but i cant multi-track because it doesnt recognize the mixer. I see 2 channells so i went to preferences and selected 'multi-track', which is great but again, no mixer or a way to route channels. Trying to figure a way around this. Help.
replyContent: Please contact support at info@audio-evolution.com

content: I thought getting an audio interface to work with a phone was a myth. Having it work in the background would make it better.
Works with motorola one power and zoom h2n with a USB OTG cable. Ultimate portable recording + sharing setup! I don't need to carry spare AA batteries for the zoom h2n anymore!

It works... Mostly, but stops randomly At around 1 minutes and 10 seconds in, on a newer Android the note 10, the app freezes while recording through usb mic, if I'm reading off a Google doc. I haven't reproduced this with other apps, but it's really annoying and I'm not sure what the solution is or where the problem comes from
replyContent: You cannot run the app in the background

content: Works great! Using a Xiaomi Mi A2 Lite, cheapo USB 1 OTG hub, Soundblaster Play 3 sound card and a Movo VXR10 shotgun mic, it records 48kHz 24-bit and lets me ramp up the sound card's gain so I can record ambient, low level sounds that just got lost in my phone's internal ADC.

Used with Sony Xperia XA1 with OTG USB... The I/O route must be set right in order to get sound in.. However, I'm trying to use for streaming. But, this i/o interface did record ‚è∫ clear sound with Xtel input interface, but going to try using it with San interface that has both out and in.
I think its a scam. Doesnt even open after i purchased
replyContent: If it doesn't update, you need to remove apps such as lucky patcher. Please contact support at info@audio-evolution.com if it still doesn't work.

content: Works with the RODE AI-1. If only the app UI design wasn't so... spartan. :)

Tried and tested quite a few USB audio recorders which just did not work. I wanted something that i could connect to my Denon DJ X1800 Mixer for recording my sets, and this works flawlessly but there are a few things i would love to see incorporated into the build. The ability to save default settings that you use, each time i connect my Phone to my mixer i need to ensure that i select Channels 9&10 which are the recording channels by default, if i forget to set this in the I/O tab then i will essentially record nothing. Audio signal trigger for recording purposes, similar to what you would see in Audacity where it receives the audio signal and automatically starts recording, very useful feture. Lastly, the app showing as full screen, even though my Samsung S8+ is apparently allowing the app to be full screen, i still have the nav buttons showing on the screen. I would give 5 stars, but the lack of a save option for your settings alone drops one star.

Fantastic app support, sent an email and got a reply within minutes, a few emails back and forth and he figured it out and fixed it for me. It was me using an OTG mini usb to micro usb cable but then my micro usb to usb c adaptor wasn't OTG so it didn't work! Ordered the right cable and works perfectly. Fantastic response, very knowledgeable and patient creator and fantastic app does exactly what I want it to now on a Samsung A70 with Samson GO mic. Highly recommend.
Does work with Samsung a70 and Samson Go, have tried multiple OTG cables.

This app is beyond garbage. Recorded something and then for some odd reason it has not shown my file as recorded complete (and it was!) despite using this numerous times since getting it off and on while suffering through the user interface flaws I mentioned they never addressed. This app hasn't been updated since 2017 so clearly they don't care about further support nor fixing any of the obvious flaws unlike updating their flagship app "Audio Evolution Mobile." Do not buy this!
I am pleased to know that usb audio recording is possible (UCA202)
Can't hold phone forced landscape is dumb. You say it doesn't but it does. You have to hold your phone sideways with the app. I even have auto rotate off and on no change.
replyContent: Apologies, we thought the review was for one of our other apps. Yes, landscape is the only orientation available.

content: This app allowed my usb soundcard the Behringer uca222 to work on my motorola G5 phone, before i bought this app my recordings had glitches/skipping, but recording with this app there are no glitches/skipping. I just wish the developers could make a driver you installed on phone and it worked with any app so i could do live Dj streams on facebook, because when i live stream on facebook i get the audio glitches/skip. I would pay ¬£20 for a usb audio driver like this one to work on facebook live.
Tried with my Behringer USB mixer works pretty well!
Not supporting my device.. wasted money
replyContent: Please contact support at info@audio-evolution.com

content: Failed on the Boss Micro BR80 but the n_track demo was fine, so I know it's not my galaxy S7. This recorded only static. And fails completely in the multi track audio evolution. Such a shame. If you fix it, I Will bye it again
Works great, easy to use. This is a simple app that does one thing, and does it well.
Worked as intended. Thank you. - OnePlus 6T and Blue Raspberry. Thank you, given what this allows me to do in terms of remote recording... A bargain!
Works well.
Works great!
Its beautifully works with my zoom u22 and Samsung a50 mobile. The customer care is so nice.i will recomend this app to my friends who works as videographers,for audio recording

Nice app. I like that it works with my RME Babyface. I wish it had ability to a layer and monitor option like a full daw. I do have a question though: On audio outputs, it gives me the xlr outputs from the interface. Is there any way to get the audio to go out to the headphone jack instead?
update?
great
Saved me a lot of money
Good and stable app.Work perfectly with zoom h5 and zoom h1 and audio technica at2020 usb.5 stars.
very good application.

i I got this app. while it records from my Mackie Profx8 mixer through USB into my S9 Plus Samsung Gakaxy phone, however when I play on my phone, the volume of the sound is very low. I am not sure why the playback when I hear (without connecting to any blue tooth device) has very low volume ??? If I share my recodings with Freinds and family, they are also not able to hear the way they are used to listening to any normal app ( after making the volume to the maximum) let me know a solution
replyContent: You probably need to increase the volume on the mixer and watch the recording level on the app.

content: This app makes digitized stereo mix downs to android a long overdue reality.
Nokia 6 + SAMSON C01U Pro works fine.

operation is simple and efficient. I'm using a UR22 mkII sand the audio quality is superb. I initially gave it 4 stars, lamenting the fact that it couldn't play back without a USB device connected, but this turned out to be an error in my part. It can playback locally on the Android. Although for $6, I do wish the UX was slicker.

I'm using yamaha Mg12xu mixer...with a samsung s9plus to record.... I don't see mixer controls on the app for example like gain, main volume etc. Please help thank you... OVERALL THE APP IS GREAT. CHEERS FOR THE APP.
replyContent: The controls are not visible when your USB audio interface does not have one. With USB mixers this is usually the case and you need to set volume there. Since mixers need to have the loudest signal mapped to 0dB on the interface, you probably need to max out the master volume.

content: Works with my Roland GO: MIXER PRO and Lexicon alpha so I can now record any XLR mic or other XLR sources AND line AND instrument level inputs. This GREATLY reduces the size of my rig. Also, by connecting my mixer's AUX SENDS to the USB audio interface, I can have a separate recording mix from the monitors or FOH, all on my Pixel XL, Nexus 4 phone or Nexus 7 pad. The funky room mic mix days are over. Happiness!
it,s not working with my behringer uca202 and Lenovo k8 plus phone. no sound while recording and playback. monitor icon shows incoming signal

One of the best audio apps available for Android. I've used this to record my DJ mixes for the past few years using a variety of Motorola android phones, and Amazon fire tablets, combined with my Behringer UCA-222 sound card. Worked like a charm and easily portable for when you're out and about. Totally recommended.
I've purchase for my s8, why it ask me to pay again when I want to download it for my tab s3?
replyContent: Please synchronize your account in Android settings

content: I installed this app on my Lenovo Yoga 3 and it worked straight off the bat. I wanted it to record my vinyl from a USB turntable, and it worked without a problem. The controls are not intuitive but do work consistently. The only missing function for me is to be able to record one whole side of a record, and the app knows that the silences defect a new track, so use a new file. As it is, unless you stop and start recording for each track, it will put the whole side in one file. This would make it perfect.
Works perfectly with the BOSS BR-800, recording and playback !! Thanks :)
I would give this app a five star if there was a pause button

I am an independent podcaster that loves to go and record outside of my studio, and I'm often in spaces that aren't conducive to bringing my big Mackie mixer. I've been looking for an Android app to replace the BossJock all I used on iOS. This app allows me to plug my XLR to USB preamp/compressor directly into my Samsung Note 9. The preamp has two channels and this app records them into 2 separate tracks making it easier to control room noise when I record in a noisy room. This app is fantastic.
Used this with my Behringer 802usb mixer and it is INCREDIBLE! Hands down worth every penny! My phone can now record EXACTLY what my mix sounds like.
It was ok just looking for something different.

Great product! I had a problem and support responded in minutes with a 
solution. Will definitely recommend. Thank you Jack

Work perfect with the Roland GO Mixer, and while it is recording, the 
camera app makes a video in perfect multitasking. A sync and editing 
section allows me to make easy live recordings with full digital content 
Thanks!

Was having issues recording with a Behringer UCA202, recordings popped and skipped.  Installed this app and problems solved.  I'm using my phone as a field recorder backup to my laptop.  Let's me WAV at the resolution and bit depth of my USB interface (48k 16 bit).  Exactly what I wanted.
Great app, able to record super-high quality vinyl through my MIYO USB DAC/ADC - works flawlessly too!!  Thanks so much!
It is a great app, it does exactly what it says and I always record on ZTE Nubia. I give it 5 Stars to the people who made it. Great job!
Only app that worked for me after trying a few - and it works well. My use case: recording from a class compliant audio interface.

I have been waiting over a week for my license to be approved after buying this, making this purchase completely useless. I suggest the developers get on this, please message me back with why this app hasn't been approved yet.
replyContent: License verification is automatic and is done by Google, so something else is wrong. Please contact support at info@audio-evolution.com

content: Very poor product, I would definitely reconsider purchasing!

Sure, it works and records audio. The user interface isn't great. I'm using a CAD u37 mic (on the supported list) but the input is way too hot and the mixer isn't great. I wanted to use this with the audio evolution mobile studio app but there's no way to monitor the recording since it wants to set the mic as the input and output. Oh well.

Works as described. UI needs serious improvement and an addition of portrait mode since this is made for mobile, e.g. the navigation and layout of the storage options is extremely confusing just because of poor visual design. An UI overhaul that includes proper padding, consistency in button design, proper color palette, etc. will make this a full fledged product and much more pleasing to use.
This app works very well with my nexus 7 and 302usb mixer. Great piece of software. Can even save in different music formats. I'm very happy with it after some days of trying it
Its nt wrkng in my oppo f3 plus . Waste of money and time.  Will the developer refund my money.  List the name of devices which supports
replyContent:
Here is our compatibility list: http://www.extreamsd.com/index.php/technology/usb-audio-driver

Please contact us by email for a refund.

content: Doesn't work on my Huawei P8 Lite and can't find refund button. Of course it is not so straightforward to have your money back, be warned!
replyContent: The P8 lite has no USB host mode and will not work indeed. It's very simple actually to get your money back: either uninstall the app within 2 hours of purchase or contact us at info@extreamsd.com.

content: I haven't been able to configure  M-Audio to work with either the Samsung Note5 or 7 works fantastically with the Samsung Note4. I wish it had other recording format options.

Hi! I really like this app. It's the only one on the app store that seems to properly recognize my USB mic. The only drawback for me is that I use this to record high quality voice over auditions when I'm away from home. The sound quality is terrific, but I have no way to display a script on screen while recording. Is there any way you guys can make this app support split screen while recording in the background? Thank you so much for this awesome app!
Very useful when i need to do high quality recording with just simple setup on my phone. Fortunately my soundcard is scarlet, same with the picture, so its compatible with the app.

I have installed this app. But till now it was not licenced..i always put my internet on..but didnt find a away..please help me..it detects nothing..i connected to ahuja mixer..it says this device has no mixer controls..what to do..my mobile meets every requirement..its redmi 3s prime..i want to record the mixer output..
Hi guys I'm into recording wild life. Will this app work if I buy a decent usb mic or is it only compatible with plugins such as the zoom ect
replyContent: It will work with USB mics as well. Please see our compatibilty list: http://www.extreamsd.com/index.php/technology/usb-audio-driver

content: The interface is simple and easy to use although I would like the control buttons to be a little larger for making quick presses. It gets 5 stars because the customer service is awesome. After my initial email about the app not working on my tablet I received a reply in less than 24 hrs and then in under a week I was emailed a link to download an updated version that works on my tablet.
Not working on my new Xperia XA1 although it used to work fine on my older Xperia M2. Recording from the same mixing desk!
So good .
Works perfectly. Using Lexicon Omega on a Samsung S8+. Worth more than what they're charging for it.
Works great with my Blue Yeti and the Google Pixel üëç

This software does not work and hangs up the moment I try to save recordings to my external sd card. I created the directory as per your instructions and it hangs up when trying to access it. Also it fails to recognise the usb Mike on the i/o interface. I tried different configurations but still nothing! I purchased it twice (once by error). May I please have both payments refunded immediately? Thanks H Walwyn
replyContent: Please contact support at info@audio-evolution.com

content: I bought an Irig HD 2 which isn't supported on android by the manufacturer but with this app (their included magical USB driver) it works perfectly both Input/Output. On galaxy s7 & 8
Would earn 5 stars if it did not screw us over and ask for license from server a week after BUYING and USING. Recording session trashed and embarrassing as all hell.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that. The app will automatically validate the license once you have an internet connection. After a successful online validation after 24 hours of first running the app, the app can be used offline until you uninstall it or clear its cache.

content: Does what it says in the description.
Works exactly as it should. I can now record demos directly from my little Yamaha THR modeling amp to my phone.   Thank you!
I want my refund on this cause I literally just purchased it. Plus I want to buy.your other app anyways so the money is going.rite back to you

content: Note 3 with cheap mic model Stadium USBMIC. Need to get a $15 USB OTG cable for it to work.
Works good with blue snowball mic and lg g5 6.0.1
No audio output on my galaxy tab e with fast track after recording. Help its not working, i paid for it.
replyContent: Please contact us at info@extreamsd.com

content: Using note 4 kitkat 4.4.4 rooted. Always do your research. Read up on otg connections to protect your host device. The developers have everything to know on their Web page. I am using an old ua-1G edirol Roland audio interface with this app. Works flawlessly.  I can record video simultaneously too. Pcr-1 works too. Major props to the developers.  This can save people lots of money recycling good technology.

... on a Nexus 7 with a Behringer XR18 in a live gig recording situation. Lovely quality, no noise. A minor criticism: the app saves multitrack files to stereo pairs and as yet I haven't found a way to split them on import into Audio Evolution. Not a problem with Cubase though, but slightly annoying as I didn't have immediate access to my PC at the time... Update in view of response below: Didn't occur to me to try that. Doh. OK, forget the criticism - it's unreservedly excellent!
replyContent: With Audio Evolution Mobile, you can record all tracks as mono. If you've recorded them with UARP, then you can long-tap the track and select 'Split into two mono tracks'

content: The sound is very very low I can barely hear myself "I work with samson co1u usb microphone"
replyContent: Please look at the Mixer tab of the app. There you can control input gain and headphones volume.

content: Using it to transfer my records to digital media via NVIDIA Shield and a Sony USB record player. Wish line in mixer worked.

I paid for this app thinking it would provide drivers so that I could listen to music through my native instruments komplete audio 6 from my Samsung s7.   although the phone did recognize the device, it didn't work.

content: Love it !
Basically works almost flawlessly with my Stock 5.1 Droid Turbo XT1254 paired with Zoom G3X. Would be even better if it could run on background somehow. Great app!
Awesome
Was able to use this with a Rode podcaster USB mic. Perfect quality.
Didn't work with my phone and microphone.
replyContent: Please contact us at info@extreamsd.com

content: Very simple and easy to use, I've used for recordings over a DAW many time, and edited in the DAW afterwards.

Wow. As a voice over artist, I was tired of dealing with computers and cables. Now I plug my Blue Mic Yeti Pro into my phone and everything works perfectly thanks to this app. No computer required! Can't wait to see more features (possibly editing?) down the road.
It didn't work for me maybe it's my fone I have a HTC desire can you please help me extreme
replyContent: Please contact us at info@extreamsd.com

content: Works great but all my recordings have an intermittent crackling sound and it sometimes is rhythmic in nature. I use a CAD U9 usb mic and a Galaxy S6.  Edit: I turned off GPS & mobile data and it records fine now. So stoked! My CAD mic clips very easily so I purchased a M-Audio MobilePre Mk II to control mic gain.
replyContent: Could you try a USB hub in between?

content: This app saved me alot of money and headaches,I was going to buy an expensive field recorder like a zoom H6.But for what? don't need to any more.
Bought it to use with AT2020USB mic.  Even works well with ancient Roland UA-5.  Fi ally quality audio on tablet.
Now I can finally record my DJ mixes with ease. Works great with my Nexus 6 and Behringer UFO202
Works on 5.1.1 Lollipop and 6.0 Marshmallow with my R8. Playback and recording both work.
No more needs to bring notebook ‚Äî now I made recordings on my Nexus 5 and Focusrite 2i2. Great works!
Superb in every way, thank you! I have a Samsung Tab A with a Samson Go Mic. Sound was jittery at first until I ran it through a USB hub... All perfect!!
Didn't work on Verizon s6
replyContent: The S6 is fully compatible, please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com

content: Can I use a USB 2.0 to audio jack adapter for recording?
replyContent: As long as it's USB audio class compliant, but we recommend using a proper USB audio interface. Please see our compatibility list here: http://www.extreamsd.com/index.php/2015-07-22-12-01-14/usb-audio-driver

content: Error: NO INPUT CHANNEL.
Works great! I use it with my Xiaomi Redmi Note 4, and a Samson Go USB mic without any issues. Although, it would be nice to be able to use it while recording video.

Works perfectly on my OnePlus One with my Blue Nessie microphone! I see there's some fancy settings to mess around with as well, but just enabling mobile recording with the Nessie has served my purposes!
Thanks üòä
Works nicely. I wish, it had a potrait mode (instead of landscape only).

Saved my day when I had to record from ZOOM H1 into my XIAOMI pad connected through a simple otg adapter. Just had to make sure I selected USB audio io when H1 connects and powers up. No glitches or irritations so far. Recordings were stereo perfect for my need and used the H1 as a complete 2 channel in/out interface. I would strongly recommend this. One feature I would have loved is to start a new file after a period of silence. Essentially split recording session automatically by detecting silence.
Also you get Audio Evolution Pro for true portable studio.

Does not recognize my input channel.  I am using a MicroUSB to 1/4" cable (standard piano or guitar cable).  I'm attempting to recording my performance directly to my android phone or tablet.  The application recognizes the USB, however it will not allow me to select it as the input device.  It forces USB as the output device and leaves INPUT blank.  This causes an internal error: "No Input Channel selected"  If this can be fixed, I will be more inclined to rate this much higher.   I'm running this on a unrooted Nexus 10 Android 5.1.1.  All I'm trying to do is pass audio from an electric keyboard to my tablet directly and record it.  Instead of plugging the quarter inch cable to my amp, I have an adapter that feeds it directly to microUSB.
replyContent: Please reply to our email. The problem is likely in the cable and you would need a proper USB audio interface, like a Lexicon Alpha for example.

content: On the phone side, I have used this with my Samsung Galaxy S3, Note 2, and the Nexus 6p (android 6.x).  At first, I used it with a Yeti, and a Yeti Pro, but now I have a Behringer XR18 air, and I can record 18 channels simultaneous to my Nexus 6p. I just recorded a musical theater play and it worked just fine for over an hour. The only drawback is that I cannot select which channels to record. The software will let me select a stereo pair of channels, or all 18 (recorded as 9 stereo pairs). That's my only drawback. Otherwise it's amazing to record 18 channels to a cell phone!

Works perfectly with Lenovo Tab S8-50 in combination with Artcessories USB Phono Plus preamp (v2).  Setup is so easy - plug in cable, start app, press record - the vu display is as clear as it could be, so I can easily set the gain on the Phono Plus on a 'test run' of the first couple of minutes of the record.  Format shifting my vinyl is finally underway with a vengeance after years of delay due to the faff of finding space for the laptop and setting its recording input for usb recording.

After banging my head against the wall looking at many free apps, which  are as good as nothing.  This one worked like a charm with both my Blue Yeti Pro and Blue Snowball microphones. Just planning my options as it's just a recording app and nothing  more. Will try to buy it again as a package maybe.
replyContent: If you need more functionality, please look at our Audio Evolution Mobile app. Because you already purchased USB Audio Recorder PRO, you do not need to do the USB audio in-app purchase anymore in Audio Evolution Mobile.

content: Great app to record my vinyl sets straight to wav or flac. Saves me having to drag a laptop about to plug in and has settings to tweak the levels etc. Perfect!
A career saver. Works with Galaxy Note 2 and Blue Yeti Pro when using a powered USB hub.
The ultimately the best
Can you add a picture showing how to add a powered hub between the tablet and recording hardware?
Not working with my asus zenfone 2, driver failed.
Otg adapter w/ splitter almost worked.   Please check filters in flashed chips inside Blue Yeti.   So close to EASY 24-bit live recordings for great shows.
This app makes my phone so much more valuable. Incredible Google themselves didn't add this functionality to Android...
I'm a professional sound recordist and find this app so useful.  I'm blown away by its simplicity, ease of use and audio quality. It works perfectly.  Thank you!

I've recorded lots of voiceovers as well as interviews with it using a CEntrance interface.  Does the job and I was even able to phantom power a condenser mic (using Samsung Galaxy S5).  Excellent app!
Got the app so I could record on the go with my Samson Go Mic and it works flawlessly! Exactly what I needed. Highly recommend! (Using Samsung Note 4)
Make sure you ate using a supported Mic. I am using a Nexus 5 and this works awesome with my blue yeti. :)
Paired with Audio Evolution Mobile DAW, this is a simply killer audio recording app.
Works on my Atheros XP8801 and  Breeze Audio mini USB DAC PD03. You rock.
On my LG g2 to ur22 with power hub
Works with HTC one m8 and Samson Go mic. A portrait mode would be nice.

I have a MOTO XT1039 which they are never updating to Android 5 , so no audio USB support. This App does the job just great with an iRig mic HD. It's a lovely simple recorder - just what I need.  It also works with the iRig Pro interface. Worth the money .
Apart from the interface needing a facelift (material design?), it works perfect for me. Straight out my DJ mixer into an Ion U Record (¬£20) then into my phone. Good quality sound, easy to use.
not working...it says that i have malware...waste of money

content: Wanted to find an app that would allow me to record my dj sets and this works great plug it in to my mixer with a usb and otg cable picked it up straight away my only issue is the recording volume could be a bit higer if there is a way to fix it please let me know.. but otherwise its great..
I bought this app to use with a zoom h1 recorder to do fuel recording directly to my tablet and I'm not disappointed by the app
I love the app, it works well on my Note4 (SM-N910U) + Samson Go Mic. I could give 5 stars though, but i want a better skin with more info on it and a portrait mode.
works with a motorola moto g 2nd gen and a sound blaster soundcard , the sound is clear...

I've used this app for quite awhile now on various devices. My current setup is a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 and a Blue Yeti Pro - mobile recording doesn't get any better or easier. Support is great and the enhancements just keep coming. BEST app ever purchased.
Used with yeti microphone and boom to record a skit. Worked great!
Had tried other apps to connect my USB Snowball, and this one works no problem!
My only complaint for this app is that the UI is atrocious. I hope for UI improvements in the future. Other than that its picking up sound from my Samson Go Mic.

I found this app while researching "recording DJ mix from mixer to tablet" I have a tesco hudl, USB audio interface by edirol, technic turntables and Gemini mixer. I can now successfully record a vinyl mix directly to my android device, no latency issues. Love it!  One niggle, every time I try and share to SoundCloud I get 'upload error' this is a real shame, Help please

This is a fantastic way to tap into MBoxes, Fast Tracks and more. And unlike another popular platform, the entire thing is less than $10! This is seriously a show saving piece of software to have at a gig! Fast voiceovers andboard tapes on-the-fly, look no further.
Works ... gain and file type .
When it works, this app is great. But it doesn't work if it detects a play store that it doesn't recognize - including those found in gapps for custom roms like cromi-x, etc. for the Asus TF700.
replyContent: Custom ROM's are no problem, we just require an official Play Store. Please contact us at info@extreamsd.com if you need a link to official ones.

content: Seems to be a few critical issues yet for my set up.

Works on my galaxy note 3 with m audio fastrack interface. My phones usb powers the interface so I didn't need the otg-y cable but oh well. I have to kill the app sometimes and re-open it because it won't always reconize my interface, that's the only minor glitch.

First, I'm just particularly happy to even find an app like this. I have it working with an Alexis IO-Express USB box and a couple of Behringer C-4 mics on a Samsung Note 12.2 tablet. Works great! Once in awhile app won't recognize USB device (am careful to plug in USB before starting app) but I'm guessing this is an android OS problem. Usually can get past this after a couple of attempts. Now I can go out and record nature sounds (my true intent) without a clumsy, constantly failing Windows based app and laptop.
Software does not work on my Galaxy Tab Pro with a Zoom H1.  You should specify what hardware is needed to run this recorder.  Waste of money.
replyContent: Both Tab Pro and H1 are working here. Please make sure the H1 runs the latest firmware and is in USB audio mode before starting the app. In any case, please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com.

content: I was about to be disappointed when it didn't work, but it turns out I have a faulty OTG cable. After digging up another, my Blue Snowball ICE worked flawlessly with this app. Definitely worth the premium if this is what you need!
Won't do any good on HTC1
replyContent: Please contact us at info@extreamsd.com

content: This combination was not specifically listed on the compatibility chart, so I was a bit hesitant.  Bought a USB 3 OTG cable , and looked up DAW recording advice and settings on Zoom's G5 website.  You need to set the G5 up correctly in 'Global Settings', e.g. 'USB Audio Monitor'. Set to 100%, you loose headphone monitoring during recording. Roll back one or two % & back it comes, but I read it may impact quality.   Anyway, it works, looking forward to improving and refining my setup. Thanks

This is a fantastic app -it literally turns your phone into a small field recorder. And it works really well. One SERIOUS drawback is the licensing -which needs to be verified every 90 days. This is generally fine as it is most likely that you will have either wifi or network coverage but if you find yourself in a situation where the license has expired and you need to record something in the field without network or wifi coverage, the app fails -will NOT record.... Imagine having a piece of hardware that is designed to occasionally not work. Don't worry though, this doesn't happen very often only when you have a once in a lifetime opportunity to capture an event. I would pay more for a lifetime license -one that truly turns the device into a reliable, battery powered field recorder.
replyContent: The 90 days limit was only present on a very old version and doesn't apply anymore since a long time. Perhaps you updated just recently?

content: Would be nice to be able to lock the left and right sliders to each other.

Works well and recognised my little no name usb audio device. Needs option of auto gain, and option of sending one input to two recording tracks at different levels. Needs to save sample rate preference. Liked the look of the blue buttons in the image as it reminds me of the AJA ki-pro recorder but got boring greenish ones in my version. Option for changing skins? Obviously this is only for usb audio, but it would be cool if I could use my phone mic. I don't need all the functions of audio evolution
Fantastic audio recording on my 2013 Nexus and Samsung S3. Recognises my crappy no name brand guitar to USB better than my laptop does. Very happy.

I've been looking for a method of portable recording with my Behringer Xenyx QX2442USB and all my Mics for a while and my laptop is way to noisey so I did a quick google and came across this.  I downloaded and very quickly tested with my Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 and Very Happy with the plug and play results. The interface could do a reworking, but other then that it does exactly what I need it to do!

Not working with Samsung Galaxy Note 4, OnePlus One. With Samsung not recognized external card, with OnePlus not recorded.  Nexus 7 with lollipop recognized card, created flac but without information, file played with all player but without any sound. Samsung Galaxy 3 has same problem that Nexus 7. Correct recognizing but without really sound.

no complaints about the app when it works; excellent recording quality and very responsive; getting it to work with the dock is a real nightmare; works when it wants to, which is almost never; my workflow includes transfer to a flash drive, then use my windows 7 computer to edit the waveform with audacity; this is a real hassle because I have to disconnect the audio device from the otg cable and then connect the drive or the dock;  scared I might damage the micro usb port on my Galaxy S4. I do wish you would include support for the dock in an update; otherwise extremely pleased; would give it 5 stars if the dock worked; 4 stars for now!
Awesome app paired up with a way above average customer-focused dev. If you're struggling with this beauty, then it's probably down to your hardware or your self.
I've had this app a long time along with audio evolution. It does a fantastic job and is regularly upgraded. Keep it up Davey. It's the best audio app on Android.
Works flawlessly for me on a note 3 running Kit Kat.  I am using Behringer Q502USB digital interface and not experienced any issues so far, primarily using it to record vinyl from my hifi.
use this every s√∫nday to record church service
Awesome! Best customer service! Solved my crashing after Lollipop update! Thanks. App is worth every penny.
replyContent: Please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com so we can solve your problem with crashing.

content: steinberg works with my nexus 5 - asus tablet is crazy distorted. TF700 is probs a no go.
Very nice app.wud give five stars if you add Mp3 option
replyContent: We can't due to patents unfortunately. OGG will compress just as well though.

content: Ui could be better, adds up capability to record audio using my samson go mic on my droid
Not yet working on nexus 7 with 5.0 lollipop.
Im on a Galaxy S5 using an Audio Technica USB MIC ATH-2500 and it works very well just make sure you do get an OTG cable and not couplers.
Does the deed. What you need. Hilarious how the little Android computer is dwarfed by the Audio interfaces. And the microphones.
Great quality and it works flawlessly.

Just started using it, but so far 5 stars. Everything is almost exactly how i would design it.  If I have more feedback I'll edit this review.   Nexus 5 and 10 / Yeti Blue  Edit: Monitor function doesn't work with headphones plugged in or not on the nexus 10. not a big deal as the yeti has its own output for monitoring.
Portable device for doing on-location VO's with minimal gear and setup.  Beautiful.  Record, upload to Dropbox, send link, done!
I try 2 plunge and play audio interface nothing work 'it will for Linux why not for android  androild is built Linux
replyContent: Please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com.

content: Came across this because I wanted to connect my yeti Mic to my phone...works as advertised, simple interface...4 stars because idk if I love it yet, but I definitely like it a lot
Refunded without hassle. Real professionals.
High quality sound
A great record program for us audio engineers!
Very good app for hi-fi field recording. Very well build, stable, simple to use, great sound quality!

Despite the fact that I fully purchased this app almost a year ago, it will not allow me to use it because it feels I have malware on my device simply because I have used the Xposed Framework app to patch my Google Play Store to a higher dpi so I can download tablet apps on my Note 3.  Dafug?  You've already got your money guys.  Stop policing my phone or I'll have to break your app to fix the problem instead.
replyContent: We only support the official Play Store. if you need higher dpi, then you can simply use the official play store first, then use the app for two days to let it cache your license and then switch back to your patched play store.

content: If it isn't a driver for the whole device, then atleast make the app look good and add some features. also, price raising? Some sites say $2 .. some $4 .. i got it for $6 .. the app just did the job, in an ugly way.. nothing more .. i really hope to see better and bigger updates soon for the app and UI
replyContent: For more features, please use our Audio Evolution Mobile app. People who purchased USB audio recorder PRO do not have to buy the in-app purchase for USB audio interfaces in Audio Evolution Mobile again. We haven't changed the price in about a year.

content: Works great!   You just need a powered OTG cable and a USB battery pack.  No foo-rah at all.
Small bugs fixed. Used successfully with griffin iMic for binaural recording

I was skeptical, but glad I gave this app a shot. I'm using a Sound Devices USBPre 2, an excellent USB class-compliant audio interface, and it is literally a plug-and-play experience. At one point during my initial test, there was some glitching, but I quickly realized it was due to a momentary power glitch in my home, not the app or my audio interface. After closing and restarting, all was well again. I'm running the USBPre 2 into a powered USB hub, through a USB OTG cable to an HTC One M7.  Winning combo!
Works great with a BLue Yeti on a rooted 2013 Nexus 7. Nexus 5 does not seem to pick the mic up properly - no sound recorded.
App info states doesn't work with Zoom H1, but you get a firmware update from the Zoom website. And mine works briliantly with Samsung Galaxy S3.

This could be an excellent product for specific purposes, yet when I bought it months ago it showed and still does, that mp3s are not supported yet. But now I see there's a player released by the same company supporting mp3s. Am I missing something or is that slightly underhanded?
replyContent: Dear Chris, please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com. This app is mainly for recording.

content: Does what it is supposed to. I am able to use my inexpensive First Act USB mic directly through a cheap $2 connector and record high quality WAV files without any of the background noise generated by my other systems' fans or spinning disks. Great option for field recording, too. I have only done brief tests so far, but the results seem very promising.
This is the app we have been waiting for! Android device is now a cheap bit bucket for a high end audio pre and DAC!
Amazing quality recording, picked up my 10 year old edirol usb input straight away.  Recorded over 30 minutes of piano music on galaxy s4 with perfect fidelity.  Thanks!

Works as advertised with latest Avid Fast Track Duo.   Recorded 24 bit at 48k using simple OTG cable.   Interface is simple.   This is a very nice app! Less hassle than with a PC. Works on Galaxy Note 3 and Tab Pro 12.2
Really impressed. I have a7 Samson C01U plugged into a Galaxy Note 3 via an OTG cable and it works a treat. No other power source required.
I am using this to record on my Moto X using a powered OTG cable, a Mackie Blackjack, an XLR cable, and any mics of my choosing. Super easy. Stoked this worked. Sound is great!

I understand limitations in programming but I would really love  to be able to monitor with headphones. No matter how laggy. My motox and at2020 sound great. Amazing support lists and the free  Demo to check compatibility sinched it. Well worth the money.

I needed quality recording and my computer is just too loud to do so. So I need to use a different room, but guess what? I have no laptops or quieter computers. What I do have is several android devices and a few usb microphones. The playback rarely works for me but that isn't too important. It records, and that's what i wanted it for.    What I've tested it with so far:    Nexus 7 (2013) + Samson Meteor Mic - Works fine. Audio is loud and clear but there is a faint electronic buzz. Perhaps it's the usb cable or otg cable, I don't know. (I don't get any noticable buzz on the PC with the same usb). As I said, it's faint and can easily be noise removed.   HTC ONE + Samson Meteor Mic - Same as above but with a louder buzz. Still quiet and easily removable.   Nexus 7 (2013) + Shure PG27 - Audio is much quieter than the Samson, but turing the gain high (this mic has gain control on it), you can get a nice loud volume. Also, no buzz. or if there is any buzz, it's so quiet it isn't worth mentioning. This is what I'll be using.  All of those without extra power.

Can recordings from a Bluetouth Mic to the app possible as I have a sm58 connected to a bluetouth adapter and is recognised by my Sony Tablet.  I Have manged to record my vocals.  Can you be.  Thanks!

Hi, Shortcut on home screen disappears on update. This works great as a line-in recorder. I use a Behringer UCA202 ($30), otg cable ($10), rca-to-mini 1/8 jack ($5), and this app. Total cost about $50. Now my Nexus 7 can be a line-in recorder. Thanks. God bless. Aaron

Now that I've been using it for a while and can give a real review. This is def. the best app. in the play store for recording with\without USB. Its honestly underpriced considering its functionality and the quality it delivers. If your looking for a high quality recording studio without carrying multiple devices, this is for you. I use a zoom G7.1ut as my interface and a NeXu5 4.4.2. and Audio Evolution PRO as my studio. Then record whatever you want. ESD are also very very helpful if you have any problems

This work good on my S3 and Zoom G5, now I can record clean voice from my guitar directly into my phone, save some of my riff. But still with one disadvantage, unable to play while recording (or am I missing something here??)

Just downloaded it to my nexus 7 2013 and my HTC One to use with my new Zoom H2n seems the Nexus 7 is a bit fussy not always detecting the device even when I start the app after first connecting otherwise 5 stars

Works great with a Dell Venue 8 tablet and the Audio-Technica A TR2500 USB mic.  I use it for voice over work and the process is clean and simple.  I wish it had the ability to do higher sampling rates, but for most jobs, this works perfect.
Very nice to have a quick mobile solution for voice over projects
Update
5 star potential.

This guy out the time in to figure out how to get clear sound past the lousy android sound stack. And with an external DAC that's an amazing difference. While not meant to be a player (its meant to be a recorder) but it's still the best player by far . If you have a DAC.
replyContent:
For our USB audio player, please see:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.extreamsd.usbaudioplayerpro

content: Tried it with my galaxy s3 and my E-MU 0404, works great with 2048 buffer. Any higher doesn`t work, but this is awesome!
Works perfectly!
Works on my Nexus 7 recording from and Ion Profile LP turntable! After successfully recording from that source, I had to buy the full version! Great app!.

I guess this is useful for people who want to record audio samples (DJs maybe?) and, after extensive research, appears to be the ONLY way of playing audio via USB on an unrooted device.......but the interface is rather unattractive, it won't play MP3s, and there's no way of getting the audio out to work on other programs. Clearly the technology is there and the hard part appears to be done, so please please please create a new app which gives basic MP3 playback via USB and allows for simultaneous charging with a USB OTG Y cable without having to root a device!! I don't buy many apps, but would pay good money for this!
replyContent: Dear David, we already have, please see http://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.extreamsd.usbaudioplayerpro.

content: I run a few smaller interfaces Creative SX USB and an M-Audio producer USB microphone. Software works well and is simple. Many thanks for the fine piece of software!   SGS3 Creative Labs SX USB M-Audio Producer USB Microphone
Simply the best for android devices
This is the one to beat. Nothing is even close. Period.
Excellente

Actually this app deserves 5 stars, but unfortunately it is very buggy. The playlist function works only sometimes and very often I can choose only 1 track in the main menu. I have to restart the app before I can choose another one.  Edit: The debug version works without problems.
replyContent: Please contact us at info@audio-evolution.com, we have a debug version ready for this issue for you to try.

content: Does exactly what it say the best ever
Incredible improvement in sound quality of Nexus 7 using Muse X5. Please bring out a player version with better playlist and directory play.

I just bought this app and it works as advertised. I read up first to make sure my Scarlett 2i2 would work, and it does. Sounds pretty good and fairly low latency running on a Samsung Note 10.1 2014. Also tried this devs DAW for a second and that works well also. My only hope is that emulators for pedals/effects and amps are developed soon. I desperately want a version of Amplitube to run on Android. If not I may turn to the dark side soon and buy an iPad, shudder to think!

the app can automatically play the next audio track.  I can live with no mp3 support, or the very basic, just functional UI; but having to tap for every song in the playlist is too much trouble that makes me want to give up on it. Please prioritize that feature. It's just a few lines of code but will make a lot of your paying customers super happy.
replyContent: The code is actually in there and works on our systems. There are a couple of customers who experience this and we have a debug version ready for them to try, but so far no one has responded yet.

content: Use it with my Nexus 7 '12 with USB rom + Fiio E07k + Fiio E12 + Senn HD598 and they sound heavenly. The only thing that would add the icing to the cake would be a player. I was looking at passing on 4 stars for the lack of a Standalone player but then nothing in life is perfect. I hope Dev's make it perfect.

No problems with my NuForce uDAC2. Playlist thingy is good enough. Just... Please add support for mp3 and maybe aac and ogg. I know this is not intended to be a player app, but this is the best app on the market that supports USB audio.
This app can work well with my PHA-1 and M-DAC, the sound has very high quality, but it can't play MP3, AAC and apple lossless format. Do you have plan support more adudio format? Plz do it.
Works great with a Nexus 7, OTG cable and a Behringer UCA202 interface -- no powered hub required.

This app rules. It works with my super generic USB audio device which is great because I have been having trouble getting this to work on my win 7 PC. I can't wait until this is added to pro evolution!
Quality product, it works really well & the tech support is amazing. I'm a very happy customer!
Please create standalone player!
!  I love your products... Great work. ..  Cheers!
It's nice to finally be able to use the Thinkpad Tab USB port. (I so wish Lenovo had done Android right the first time.) Excellent stuff. Read up, try the trial.
Was experiencing glitches in audio using HRT Microstreamer and Galaxy S3. Developer responded to email and fixed problem within 24 hours!  Software now works flawlessly. Very happy customer.
Transformer Prime and Ibasso D7 working side by side.

Works awesome for playback of 24 bit WAV files from HD Tracks (tested with "When Doves Cry" by Prince). Just needs a powered hub, which I used a U-Speed USB 3.0 powered hub with it. Nexus 7 FHD (2013) with Samsung OTG cable.
Works perfect with Xperia Z and fender SuperChamp X2

System:  Motorola XT910 (ver.4.1.2) USB OTG cable DYNAUDIO XEO3  It plays flac files for any MUSIC lover :-)  The APP was born to be NOT a player of music libraries... but if you want to be free from iDevices... ;-) ... it's a good point for the starting !

This app, coupled with Audio evolution Mobile, allows me to record high quality audio on my Galaxy S3 and Nexus 7 without any latency, and for that I'm extremely grateful. Unfortunately, audio output and input when using my M audio Producer USB are so quiet to  the point that I have raise the volume of every track until they're clipping just to obtain an audible volume.
But, is there a way for this to work in conjunction with the camcorder?
replyContent: Unfortunately not. As the second sentence of the app's description says: Warning: this is not a generic driver, you can only playback and record from within this app.

content: Logitech G930 7.1 can record and hear throw programm, but not poweramp or other player. Can't play mp3.
Works properly with citronic ac-1 usb and a motorola xoom. Will be using to make my podcasts,  and now no longer need to buy a new laptop.
I use this with Scarlett 2i2 and 2 condensers.  My s4 powers all.  Simply perfect app worth every penny.  Great work dev.

Working great with RME babyface! Thanks! Tested on moto xoom & nexus 7. Would like to see: the time smaller & much bigger meters for monitoring.. Also Multichannel recording into interleaved WAV format would save strain on storage while recording lots of tracks...  Also maybe a visual error count (if any skips were recorded) Awesome Dev, very helpful & great communications.

Using Nexus4 with Franco kernel (with ziddey patch for USB OTG) Playback works fine with creative x-fi  at 96kHz/24bits. Multichannel through it output/spdif also works fine at 48kHz/24bit .  One thing missing would be Sample rate converter.  Playing of 44.1kHz streams should be supported at their original rates. I think they are being played at 48Khz.  Couldn't playback at 44.1/48kHz from my usb powered headphones- plantronics :blackwire C420-M,LYNC. But could record and playback only at 8kHz/16kHz

I had no problems what so ever with recording from a blue snowball, and I could even record my electric guitar using a cheap usb cable. Only con is that there isn't any sound output when monitoring, but this is probably more down to androids high latency problems. Overall i highly recommend this app if you want to make usable recordings on your phone.
It does what is says. #awesome
This gives me the ability to use my nexus 7 as a recording device for studio quality music

There was a time when I had to drag a rack box and DAT to record somewhere.  Now I'll experiment with a smaller,  smarter stereo field rig. Thanks for all the work you put in... A dedicated customer.... Pete

I tested this product with Shure's PG-42 USB Mic and it's working fine.  Some time when you unplug the mic and the apps is on. It get confused.  But turn the app off and launch it again and it will work fine.

Using with Presonus 1818vsl without any issues. And the audio output DOES work using the latest firmware. Played 96kHz/24bit FLAC files and it sounds amazing. Can't wait for multitrack support in Audio Evolution!!

I am completely rewriting my review. I have had the time to play with the latest update to the app and the only issue I had with the app seems to have gone...Well Done! As the app has no real instructions, here is how I got my Droid Razor HD/Fiio E07K to work. First power up the phone, then connect the DAC/Amp to the phone. Turn on the DAC, turn on the app on the phone. Go to playlist, select the folder icon which brings up the music files. Then select a music file Wait maybe 30 seconds and hit play on the app...99% of the time I get music. If I do not, I turn off the app and then turn it on again and select the music again an hit play and all is well. I do have one question. The apps music files are on my memory, not the SD card. How do I move them to where I have room. The sound through a decent DAC is WAY better than anything I ever got out of my iPOD. Thanks for the update!  Ok, a new update....the shuffle feature is GREAT! well done folk
Has some issues with it crashing when working with my dac. But it's been resolved by deleting app data. Good times with flac :-)

If you have a USB microphone and a tablet with a USB slot, this is a fabulous option for recording in a quiet environment. Eliminates the fan noise from your laptop/netbook/PC/whatever that you had your USB microphone connected to before.  And much cheaper than a digital recorder!

Some ticking in the beginning, not sure why, but gone is seconds though.  I'd like to have the option to link volume controls (both left and right move at same time). And, I'd like to see a numerical representation of the volume level.  Other wise....so far zo good.   I use it to record a 9 piece acoustic celtic sessions.

I recently paired my Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 with a Crown stereo mike and Nexus 7 to record a large choral group. The microphone had batteries and did not need phantom power. I recorded more than two hours of 44.1 hz 24 bit stereo a d had 55% battery power remaining on the Nexus. The sound was excellent.
Works great with my note 10.1 and blue yeti!

Using this with my Nexus 7, also Samsung Galaxy Note II.  My external USB audio device is a Behringer UFO-202 (U-Phono) which allows line level or phono levels. Can actually transfer vinyl to the Android now. UFO-202 is available for ~$30. Also using my binaural mics with this rig. OTG cable req'd. BIG HINT: highly rec'd using "Stay On" or "Stay Awake" apps to prevent device from going to sleep.

I managed to get the app to record a few times for our church but it kept on making the tablet freeze up.  Also, when it did work, if the screen timed out it would freeze up quite badly. It's a great idea and it might work on some devices, but not mine :-(
I hooked up my Nexus 7 to both a Cakewalk UA-1G and a Behringer UC202 using a micro USB OTG cable. Everything worked great.  Thanks!

USB Audio Recorder Pro and Audio Evolution are the best and really only PROFESSIONAL multi track recording/editing/mixing solution for android hands down!!!! Nothing even comes close!!!! And the software just keeps getting better and better!!!! Thank You!!!!

For the price you really can't beat it.  All it does is give you control over inputs to record and an output within the app.  Works perfect with my lexicon omega, and behringer uca 200(powered over micro usb!). A great field recording tool for an audio engineer like myself, or a way to record on the cheap as the mood strikes as a musician.
It worked immediately with the Yeti Pro and the Asus Eee Pad Transformer TF101 (with USB adapter and a Tripp Lite USB repeater cable). I now have an excellent 24-bit portable recording system.

Running a Blue Snowball mic with this app. It works great. Also bought the Audio Evolution app from the same developers. These two apps paired up make an excellent portable studio for all genres. A must for any musician on the go.

It only enables very basic functionality. I cant change inputs or monitor audio but the gain nob works and I can record sound with it. That's all I've ever wanted really; an apogee quality signal chain that fits in my pocket. If it interfaced better with the function knob and the audio monitoring worked I'd be made up but I'm just surprised an officially apple only product is supported at all really. Very handy despite the bugs. Awesome!
replyContent:
Thank you for your review.
You can change inputs by using the Selector combo box at the right. The device does not expose any hardware monitoring controls, so we cannot offer what is not there.

content: I have been using this app for a while....with my nexus7.. It works really fine on recording with my komplete audio 6 and focusrite scarlett 2i2.  It doesn't work with playback properly ...the sound is breaking up so much....  But not a problem...for my purpose.  Using it at church to record my band.... It let me have a great qulity sound recording..  App is not as fancy looking....but what it does is really fantastic.....and I'm really glad there is such an app...  5 stars are worth for this app.. Ever since I found this app...for the professional sound recording..all I need is my portable usb interface, otg cable, and nexus.....I don't need laptop or desktop...to do my job done...  It gave me so much time saving...in matter of what I do... And thank u so much for continues updates....it gets better and better!!!!!  Thank u guys...

Amazing work by this developer!  Works beautifully with my Presonus 22VSL on an ASUS Transformer Prime TF201.  I appreciate the amount of work that goes into supporting a variety of USB audio interfaces.  The developer sends out periodic emails with progress updates.  To previous reviews that have given one star, you don't rate an app based on what *you* want it to be..  It's clearly titled an "Audio Recorder" not a music player of which there are plenty to choose from.
Works with a rock smith cable.  Awesome.

It would be great if Android offered a plug and play pure USB audio out. This ain't it... This allows a whole 1 song playback at a time. No albums or playlist and doesn't allow use of great streaming services. They went to the trouble of creating an app that offer USB audio then gave it no meaningful functionality. why!?! Your half way there now make something that just works. Refund?  This app just doesn't reach its full potential...  The developer has the tech and should use it to release a separate standalone great sounding hifi music player app that the audiophile community could get excited about.  This current app is for a very very small niche market that wants to record 24 bit sound with their smartphone (also comes with a kinda sort of music player that works for some stuff)?!? Please tell us a "REAL" FLAC + MP3 USB audio music player app is on the way?
replyContent: The app's title and description clearly indicate that this is a recorder, meant for high quality audio recording using a USB audio device. There actually IS playlist functionality (3rd tab) because some people wanted to have this. We think it would be honest to rate it against what the app was meant to do, not what someone wanted it to be.

content: I am extremely happy I can record audio with my android devices. I am pumped for the addition of USB recording to audio evolution. Please please hurry with this. By the way I have used my blue yeti and my blue snowball ice to record on my Acer a200 works like a champ. Just as well as a computer with a sound card...... no latency
Doesn't work with nexus 7 with JDS Labs ODAC. Any workaround solution?
The zoom h4 works and DIDN'T need hub power.  Bought both programs and look forward to you merging this USB input ability into your multitrack program.

best android recording.  I have a Nexus 7 and after some trial and error with a very cool dev its working great.  Cant wait until the USB recording capabilities are added to his audio evolution app. Great Dev and a GREAT app worthy of competing with garage band.

Tried to use USB audio playback through my E17 but it does not work on my Nexus 7 or Galaxy Nexus. The app does not recognize that the E17 is plugged on either device.  *EDIT*  After working with the developer I got the E17 to function with my Nexus 7. It's finicky to get it started, but it does work. The trick seems to be cycling through the inputs on the E17 after it is connected to the Nex7. Once the E17 screen says "LOCK", this app will recognize the device. The couple of downsides to the software is that it doesn't play audio from any other apps besides it's own, and it doesn't play MP3 files. Neither of these issues are a dealbreaker for me as I mostly listen to FLAC files but it would be nice if I didn't have to change the inputs/cables just to hear audio from a different application. With that said, I still give this app 5 stars because it allows me to play my FLAC files through my E17/Nex7 without rooting, and because of the wonderful support from the developer.
replyContent: Our Nexus 7 in combination with the E17 works. Sometimes it just needs re-plugging to get recognized.

content: Bought and hoped that the program would allow connection between Galaxy P7500 and Behringer 2442 USB mixing board. I initally had trouble making the connection, the tablet did not want to recognize anything plugged into the USB? Davy was great and put a lot of time into helping me connect up and between us we made it work fine and no Apple product had to be purchased!
The application works extremely well on my Nexus 7, but won't recognize any USB audio device on my HTC One V CDMA.

The app didn't seem to detect my Blue Snowball but I recently upgraded to a Blue Yeti and it works perfectly. How ridiculously good that it's possible to record on the go with a phone or tablet!  This needs to be integrated into stock Android yesterday.
Works well with Blue Snowflake and A500.

I recently purchased a Blue Yeti Pro USB Microphone and was looking for a way to use it with my Nexus 7. I hooked up my Micro USB-host cable and attached the Yeti. The Yeti powered up and the app found it. It will also allow playback through the headphone jack of the Yeti too. Try the trail, if it works for you shell out the $5 for this great app. Leaving it at 4 stars because it could use a little graphical improvement.
Works flawlessly on my Iconia A500, thanks for this!
Using this with USB on the go cable, Turtle Beach Audio Advantage Micro 2 USB to optical converter and a high quality hi fi DAC to play music from my Nexus 10. Worked first time.
I use this with my nexus 7 and m-audio fast track usb. I can now record from our mixer and get our full jams into Wave file.

It's work waiting to combine with Audio Evolution Mobile   for function playback could you default to 48000 rate  a crack sound occur when play with 44100 rate but for 48000 is OK but I can't choose it in playback tab please fix this very thanks
Thanks for doing what Google couldn't get right.

The only app that can make android audiophile come true by give ability to use external usb DAC. Connect my Nexus 7 with Fiio E17 and it works like a charm. Perfect solution to somebody who doesn't want alter their device (install custom ROM, root, etc.). Hope the playback feature will improve or release an app that enable usb audio driver for system wide.

I wasn't sure if this would work. I have an Alesis Multimix 8 and plugged it in and could not believe that it worked so well and so easily. 5 stars definitely. I do wish it had the ability to multitrack though.
Works perfectly with Nexus 7 and Xenyx X1832USB. Just need to get a more portable interface now! Look forward to integration with Audio evolution Mobile.
Confirmed working on Asus Infinity with the Numark I/O card. Sound is crisp and very useful options to fine tune.

Great customer service.  Works with asus transformer but you can not use the Keyboard usb port and the program is a bit buggy, but for a first attempt at adding android functionality to USB Dacs this is a great program
Usb soundwave 7.1 digital  external sound card,  phone is Photon Q,  used on the go usb adapter, mixer volumes wont move though,
Does exactly what it says on the box

Love it! Cant say it enough and the developers are very helpful. You can tell how proud they are with this product. They will look for solutions if you're having issues. Worth every penny! Nexus 7 - Samsung Galaxy S2 HD LTE

Absolutely brilliant development. Recording and playback works perfectly, and I can reduce the buffer to the minimum without problems (and without killing other running tasks such as WiFi). Can't wait to see if Audio Evolution Mobile is upgraded to use this USB driver - ultra portable multi track recording possibly within reach! Keep up the good work.

This is a great workaround for the fact that android doesn't already provide USB audio. However, I can't seem to play my recordings from within the app. Pressing the play button does nothing. Clicking a recording shows me a prompt to delete or rename the file. ? I guess this will get fixed eventually.

The Shure is pretty much the same as the MicPort Pro. I'm just an old Shure fan which is why I went with it instead of the immensely popular MicPort-no offense guys, you've got a great product too.  ;-) Only issues (so far) is an inability to switch to monitoring thru my tablet and no MP3 options. The sound seems clear and pretty just like it should be. Any editing of the sound file, if it's in there, is so far; "elusive". nonetheless...thanks for giving us a Droid interface for USB devices. May the force be with you.  dc

Works perfectly on my Samsung Galaxy Nexus (T-959) running CM10 with an oddball Aim AS301DTS USB interface which features stereo in at 48 kHz.  Great piece of work solving a very difficult problem (USB sound on Android.)  Anxiously awaiting integration with developer's Audio Evolution Mobile multi-track recording app, another awesome piece of kit.

Highly recommended. I can now record pristine quality audio into my Nexus 7 from my Blue Yeti USB microphone. Everything works perfectly, no need for an external USB powered hub.¬†The developer deserves the highest praise for overcoming Android's audio limitations with this excellent app.
Tested on Asus Transformer tf101, with Samson c03u USB mic.

This is a great breakthrough that allows use of an external DAC with most Android devices. The sound quality takes a big jump upwards when I use an external DAC in place of the internal DAC in my Nexus 10. As many other reviewers noted, the playback functionality is very low so far. As far as I can tell, you can only manually open one song at a time to listen to. It does not even allow for playing a whole album or folder of songs, and so does not have shuffle play or a way to skip to the next song, or any other basic playback features. So only four stars for now, but once some of these features are added, then it will deserve 10 stars. And to be fair, the developer intended it as a recording app, but the market for an app with improved playback will probably be larger (at least until Android itself includes external DAC support).

This allows my Galaxy S3 running AOKP to play 24/96 files via an external iBasso D6 DAC/amp!! As it's designed primarily as a recording (not playback) app, there's a long way to go from a basic useability standpoint, but it appears the major hurdles between audiophile music and the external DACs that can do it justice have finally been surmounted!! BRAVO!!!

The dev is fantastic and very good at listening and discussing more. Got my usb DAC, an iBasso DB2 working. Would pay twice if he builds player functionality too with EQ and play list/ folder support.
Work with my nexus 7 and D-zero. Hope to see more features for playback. Keep up the good work.

I have everything connected and can record in great quality. Davy helped me figure out where the .wav files are actually being saved to. The directory shows /storage/emulated/0/USBAudioRecorderPRO, but USBAudioRecorderPRO does not show up under my nexus7 folder on the computer at all. Very frustrating at first. But Davy help me figure it out and it works great! Just reboot your Nexus 7 if the folder is not showing up on windows 7 (MTB support problems) Great customer support and timely in fashion.

Works great with my Galaxy Note 2 and Zoom H4. I didn't think it would work with the H4 as it requires proprietary drivers for windows, but I can record, live monitor and playback fine. Stereo condensers, 1/4 and XLR with phantom power inputs for my phone! Amazing.

This is a fantastic first step towards Android becoming a serious audiofile device. While the name says it's a "Recorder", it handels playback of local FLAC files through my RSA Intruder wonderfully. Slight stuttering can be heard while multitasking (i.e. reading email while playing music), but this is easily resolved by lowering the buffer size in the app itself.   What I'd really like to see in the future is either playlist support, or a fork of this app with more of a focus on being a music player over a recording device. This would easily make this the must have app for music fans with high end gear.
